intro: Loncomelos spetae, commonly known as the Spetae's morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds used in traditional medicine. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and herbal practices.
